faq.question: How can I register a company in Pakistan?
faq.answer: To register a company in Pakistan, you need to submit an application to SECP, reserve a company name, draft the memorandum and articles of association, and complete the incorporation process.

faq.question: What are the legal requirements for divorce in Pakistan?
faq.answer: In Pakistan, divorce procedures vary by personal law. Muslim couples must follow the Talaq process, including notification to the Union Council. For other faiths, legal separation follows civil court procedures.

faq.question: How do I resolve a property dispute in Pakistan?
faq.answer: Property disputes are resolved through civil courts. If you have valid ownership documents, you can file a case under the Transfer of Property Act or Specific Relief Act.

faq.question: Can a foreigner own property in Pakistan?
faq.answer: Yes, foreigners can own property in Pakistan with special approval from the Board of Investment and compliance with local land laws.

faq.question: What are the steps for filing a criminal case in Pakistan?
faq.answer: To file a criminal case, visit your local police station to register an FIR. If the police refuse, you can approach the Magistrate under Section 22-A of the CrPC for complaint registration.
